bug.author: grantlj
bug.description:
In the seamless_cloning.cpp (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/master/modules/photo/src/seamless_cloning.cpp>https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/master/modules/photo/src/seamless_cloning.cpp</denchmark-link> ) the line 94 asserts:
Why the maxxd is compared with dest.rows instead of dest.cols? (Also, the maxyd is compared with dest.cols). I think the maxxd is on the width (col) direction, while the maxyd is on the height direction (row) direction. Hence, it should be changed into: CV_Assert(minxd >= 0 && minyd >= 0 && maxxd <= dest.cols && maxyd <= dest.rows);

comments.comment: Right! PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/11208>#11208</denchmark-link> changed meaning of variables, but doesn't update check condition. Perhaps this check can be removed at all, because it is redundant - dest(roi_d) operation has similar check inside.
